results.title: And now the screaming starts!
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Milton Subotsky, Max J Rosenberg and Amicus Productions
results.brief_description: In this horror film, set in a haunted house in the late 18th century, Stephanie Beacham plays a young bride who is raped on her wedding night by a ghost who takes the form of a disembodied hand. When she tries to uncover the malevolant, dark secrets of her husband’s ancestry she is thwarted at every turn, and those who try to help her end up dead. Utterly terrorised, her mental health begins to fail and a psychic doctor (Peter Cushing) is employed to cure her. Despite the dated special effects, this British thriller still has vintage appeal, drawing on the themes of demonic possession and a family curse. Also known as “Fengriffen” and “Bride of Fengriffen”. Adapted from the novel by David Case.

results.title: Deuce Bigalow male gigolo
results.creator_credit: Mike Mitchell, Barry Bernardi, Sid Ganis and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: This low brow comedy from Saturday Night Live alumni Rob Schneider is about a luckless fish tank cleaner who gets mistaken for a male gigolo, and must grapple with the complications that mistaken identity brings. Jokes are mainly in the order of the scatological and deliberately offensive - following in the footsteps of Adam Sandler (who is executive producer) and the Farrelly brothers, although with decidedly less polish.

results.title: Unidentified flying oddball
results.creator_credit: Russ Mayberry, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Mark Twain’s ‘A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court’ this Disney film version provides a new twist to the story by setting it in today’s space age. NASA scientist Tom Trimble (Dennis Dugan) and his robot clone accidentally find themselves travelling back in time to the land of merry England and the court of King Arthur (Kenneth More). Here Trimble encounters the lovely Alisande (Sheila White), King Arthur’s enemy the evil knight Sir Mordred (Jim Dale), and Merlin (Ron Moody) the Court’s magician. Will Trimble be drawn into Sir Mordred’s evil plot to oust King Arthur or will he save the day and in doing so stop history from being changed forever? Cast includes John Le Mesurier as Sir Gawain.

results.title: The Hidden Fortress = Kakushi toride no san akunin [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Masumi Fujimoto and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: The story of rival clans, hidden gold and a princess in distress becomes, in Kurosawa’s masterful hands, a thrilling mixture of fairy-tale and Samurai movie, with the finest elements of a John Ford Western and a Shakespearean drama thrown in for good measure. Toshiro Mifune excels in a role which he subsequently made his own - the unmatched warrior - and his skill as horseman and swordsman is matched only by Kurosawa’s skill behind the camera and in the editing suite. Misa Uehara as the princess in exile is a potent mix of strength and vulnerability, and the choreographed set pieces set cinematic precedents which are hard to follow. Also available on VHS [308157].

results.title: Yojimbo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: A fine film by Kurosawa, in which a wandering samurai exploits two gangs who are fighting for control of a village. Very much a tongue-in-cheek samurai film, with Toshiro Mifune quite superb as the warrior who teaches both warring factions a lesson. Reverred for its black humour and technical mastery, “Yojimbo”, like many of Kurosawa’s works, was later remade — by Sergio Leone, as “A fistful of dollars”. Also available on VHS [301894].

results.title: Seven Samurai = Shichinin no samurai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Shojiro Motoki and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: In 16th century Japan a primitive village, dreading the annual raid of bandits who carry off the harvest and the village girls, decides to hire Samurai to help defend themselves. With his help, six others are recruited. Overcoming the villagers’ fears, the Samurai begin to organise their defence. After a long period of waiting, the bandits attack. A series of violent battles follows, which ends at last in victory for the Samurai and the villagers. Hailed as one of the greatest films ever made, “Seven Samurai” was the second Kurosawa film to bring him great acclaim in the West (the first being “Rashomon”); Kurosawa presents peerless battle scenes, but he also encapsulates the humanity of the villagers’, their plight and the honour of the fearsome Samurais. Stars Toshiro Mifune and Takashi Shimura. Also available on VHS [301009].

results.title: Sanjuro = Tsubaki Sanjuro [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: This samurai film, in which a shabby warrior helps young clan members root out corruption among the elders of their clan is a kind of sequel to “Yojimbo” with excellent fighting sequences and effective moments of humour. Toshiro Mifune reprises his role as the ‘man with no name’ from the earlier film. He is a shambling, scratching, bedraggled character described by many critics and a cross between Robin Hood and John Wayne, with a touch of Humphrey Bogart thrown in. With a heady blend of traditional Japanese theatrical conventions and the language of Western film-making this is a masterpiece of comedy-drama. Cast also includes Masao Shimizu and Tatsuya Nakadai. Also available on VHS [301895].

results.title: Powder
results.creator_credit: Victor Salva, Daniel Grodnik, Roger Birnbaum, Caravan Pictures and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: A sci-fi film about a 16-year-old albino boy who, having spent all his life living in his grandparents basement until their passing away, suddenly finds himself in a totally foreign environment when he is removed from his home and placed into school. Jeremy Reed (Sean Patrick Flanery) nick-named Powder, has special powers but his strange physical appearance and behaviour causes division within the school and the community with bigotry and hatred on one side and respect and friendship on the other. An unusual modern day fable. Cast includes Mary Steenburgen, Lance Henriksen, Jeff Goldblum.

results.title: Holy man
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, Roger Birnbaum and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: An examination and re-evaluation of morals and ethics drives this comedy/drama about a television executive and a marketing manager who despite loathing each other, must work together. The two identify their misguided paths assisted by an enigmatic character named ‘G’, who seems to possess miraculous powers. Stars Eddie Murphy (as G), Jeff Goldblum and Kelly Preston.

results.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sommers, Laurence Mark and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of the classic 19th century novel ‘The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn’ by American writer, Mark Twain. This is a story about Huck Finn (Elijah Wood), a poor uneducated boy who has run away from home to escape his abusive drunken father, and Huck’s chance encounter with Jim (Courtney S. Vance), an escaped slave. Together the two follow the Mississippi River finding adventure and drama and some rather dubious characters by the names of the King (Jason Robards) and the Duke (Robbie Coltrane). Cast also includes Ron Perlman and Laura Bundy.
